#Text=CHAPTER IX .
#Text=TUPPENCE ENTERS DOMESTIC SERVICE
#Text=WHEN Tommy set forth on the trail of the two men , it took all Tuppence ’s self-command to refrain from accompanying him .
#Text=However , she contained herself as best she might , consoled by the reflection that her reasoning had been justified by events .

#Text=The two men had undoubtedly come from the second floor flat , and that one slender thread of the name “ Rita ” had set the Young Adventurers once more upon the track of the abductors of Jane Finn .
#Text=The question was what to do next ?
#Text=Tuppence hated letting the grass grow under her feet .
#Text=Tommy was amply employed , and debarred from joining him in the chase , the girl felt at a loose end .
#Text=She retraced her steps to the entrance hall of the mansions .
#Text=It was now tenanted by a small lift-boy , who was polishing brass fittings , and whistling the latest air with a good deal of vigour and a reasonable amount of accuracy .
#Text=He glanced round at Tuppence ’s entry .
#Text=There was a certain amount of the gamin element in the girl , at all events she invariably got on well with small boys .
#Text=A sympathetic bond seemed instantly to be formed .
#Text=She reflected that an ally in the enemy ’s camp , so to speak , was not to be despised .
#Text=“ Well , William , ” she remarked cheerfully , in the best approved hospital-early-morning style , “ getting a good shine up ? ”
#Text=The boy grinned responsively .
#Text=“ Albert , miss , ” he corrected .
#Text=“ Albert be it , ” said Tuppence .
#Text=She glanced mysteriously round the hall .
#Text=The effect was purposely a broad one in case Albert should miss it .
#Text=She leaned towards the boy and dropped her voice :
#Text=“ I want a word with you , Albert . ”
#Text=Albert ceased operations on the fittings and opened his mouth slightly .
#Text=“ Look !
#Text=Do you know what this is ? ”
#Text=With a dramatic gesture she flung back the left side of her coat and exposed a small enamelled badge .

#Text=It was extremely unlikely that Albert would have any knowledge of it -- indeed , it would have been fatal for Tuppence ’s plans , since the badge in question was the device of a local training corps originated by the archdeacon in the early days of the war .
#Text=Its presence in Tuppence ’s coat was due to the fact that she had used it for pinning in some flowers a day or two before .

#Text=But Tuppence had sharp eyes , and had noted the corner of a threepenny detective novel protruding from Albert ’s pocket , and the immediate enlargement of his eyes told her that her tactics were good , and that the fish would rise to the bait .
#Text=“ American Detective Force ! ” she hissed .
#Text=Albert fell for it .
#Text=“ Lord ! ” he murmured ecstatically .
#Text=Tuppence nodded at him with the air of one who has established a thorough understanding .
#Text=“ Know who I ’m after ? ” she inquired genially .
#Text=Albert , still round-eyed , demanded breathlessly :
#Text=“ One of the flats ? ”
#Text=Tuppence nodded and jerked a thumb up the stairs .
#Text=“ No. 20 .
#Text=Calls herself Vandemeyer . Vandemeyer ! Ha ! ha ! ”
#Text=Albert ’s hand stole to his pocket .
#Text=“ A crook ? ” he queried eagerly .
#Text=“ A crook ?
#Text=I should say so .
#Text=Ready Rita they call her in the States . ”
#Text=“ Ready Rita , ” repeated Albert deliriously .
#Text=“ Oh , ai n’t it just like the pictures ! ”
#Text=It was .
#Text=Tuppence was a great frequenter of the cinema .
#Text=“ Annie always said as how she was a bad lot , ” continued the boy .
#Text=“ Who ’s Annie ? ” inquired Tuppence idly .
#Text=“ ‘ Ouse-parlourmaid .
#Text=She ’s leaving to-day .
#Text=Many ’s the time Annie ’s said to me : ‘ Mark my words , Albert , I would n’t wonder if the police was to come after her one of these days . ’
#Text=Just like that .
#Text=But she ’s a stunner to look at , ai n’t she ? ”
#Text=“ She ’s some peach , ” allowed Tuppence carelessly .
#Text=“ Finds it useful in her lay-out , you bet .
#Text=Has she been wearing any of the emeralds , by the way ? ”
#Text=“ Emeralds ?
#Text=Them ’s the green stones , is n’t they ? ”
#Text=Tuppence nodded .
#Text=“ That ’s what we ’re after her for .
#Text=You know old man Rysdale ? ”
#Text=Albert shook his head .
#Text=“ Peter B. Rysdale , the oil king ? ”
#Text=“ It seems sort of familiar to me . ”
#Text=“ The sparklers belonged to him .
#Text=Finest collection of emeralds in the world .
#Text=Worth a million dollars ! ”
#Text=“ Lumme ! ” came ecstatically from Albert .
#Text=“ It sounds more like the pictures every minute . ”
#Text=Tuppence smiled , gratified at the success of her efforts .
#Text=“ We have n’t exactly proved it yet .
#Text=But we ’re after her .
#Text=And” -- she produced a long-drawn-out wink -- “I guess she wo n’t get away with the goods this time . ”
#Text=Albert uttered another ejaculation indicative of delight .
#Text=“ Mind you , sonny , not a word of this , ” said Tuppence suddenly .
#Text=“ I guess I ought n’t to have put you wise , but in the States we know a real smart lad when we see one . ”
#Text=“ I ’ll not breathe a word , ” protested Albert eagerly .
#Text=“ Ai n’t there anything I could do ?
#Text=A bit of shadowing , maybe , or such like ? ”
#Text=Tuppence affected to consider , then shook her head .
#Text=“ Not at the moment , but I ’ll bear you in mind , son .
#Text=What ’s this about the girl you say is leaving ? ”
#Text=“ Annie ?
#Text=Regular turn up , they ‘ ad .
#Text=As Annie said , servants is some one nowadays , and to be treated accordingly , and , what with her passing the word round , she wo n’t find it so easy to get another . ”
#Text=“ Wo n’t she ? ” said Tuppence thoughtfully .
#Text=“ I wonder -- -- ”
#Text=An idea was dawning in her brain .
#Text=She thought a minute or two , then tapped Albert on the shoulder .
#Text=“ See here , son , my brain ’s got busy .
#Text=How would it be if you mentioned that you ’d got a young cousin , or a friend of yours had , that might suit the place .
#Text=You get me ? ”
